metadata.Title: CVE-2020-13659 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
address_space_map in exec.c in QEMU 4.2.0 can trigger a NULL pointer dereference related to BounceBuffer.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-13659` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

qemu - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-guest-agent - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-keymaps - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-kvm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-aarch64 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-arm - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-common - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-mips - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-misc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-ppc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-sparc - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-system-x86 - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-user - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-user-static - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
qemu-utils - 2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: qemu package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.0.0+dfsg-2ubuntu1.47+esm1').
